net.sourceforge.waters.model.expr

Class ExpressionScanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.model.expr.ExpressionScanner

  • public class ExpressionScanner
extends Object

    The expression scanner. The expression scanner analyses a stream of characters and converts it to tokens for the parser.

    Supported tokens:

    Separators
    The special separator characters produce tokens of their own: '(' (Token.Type.OPENBR), '[' (Token.Type.OPENSQ), ')' (Token.Type.CLOSEBR), ']' (Token.Type.CLOSESQ), ',' (Token.Type.COMMA).
    Operators (Token.Type.OPERATOR)
    Operator tokens such as + or .. as defined by a OperatorTable.
    Numbers (Token.Type.NUMBER)
    Any sequence of digits, optionally preceded by a minus sign, forms a number token.
    Symbols (Token.Type.SYMBOL)
    Any character sequence matching the regular expression [a-zA-Z:_][a-zA-Z0-9:_]* forms a symbol token. In addition, any sequence of characters enclosed in curled braces {...} can form a part of a symbol. Possible symbols are: x25, :accepting, a{1+7}bc{- +}.
    Author:
    Robi Malik

      • isWatersIdentifier

        public static boolean isWatersIdentifier(String word)
        Checks whether a string qualifies as a Waters identifier. Strings that pass this test can be used as the name of a valid SimpleIdentifierProxy, or as names of any Waters elements that are identified by strings rather than identifiers. Identifiers must start with a letter, underscore, colon, or escaped group, which can be followed by more letter, digits, underscores, colons, or escaped groups.
        Parameters:
        word - The string to be examined.
        Returns:
        true if the given string is a valid identifier.

      • checkWatersIdentifier

        public static void checkWatersIdentifier(SimpleIdentifierProxy ident)
                                  throws TypeMismatchException
        Checks whether the given simple identifier has a syntactically correct name. Identifiers must pass the test isWatersIdentifier().
        Throws:
        TypeMismatchException - to indicate the name is invalid.
